intro: Gelseminum araliaceum, commonly known as the yellow moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom at night. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain toxic seeds. Its flowers emit a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
